ValueCondition Less than zero

Greater than zero The instance is greater than obj (parameter).

member.summary: Gets the filter coefficients to design a Savitzky-Golay smoothing FIR filter.
member.param: Specifies the order of the polynomial.
(2* sidePoints (parameter) + 1) is frame size, which specifies how many data points to use in the polynomial fitting. Frame size must be greater than polynomialOrder (parameter).

The designed filter coefficients, a frame size-by-frame size matrix. The first (frame size - 1)/2 rows are applied to the signal during the terminal transient. The last (frame size - 1)/2 rows are applied to the signal during the startup transient. The center row is applied to the steady state.
member.exception: (2 * sidePoints (parameter) + 1) is less than or equal to polynomialOrder (parameter). -or-polynomialOrder (parameter) is less than one.

A required operation in the analysis library cannot be found.

A weighting vector with length (2 * sidePoints (parameter) + 1), which specifies how many data points to use in the polynomial fitting.

The designed filter coefficients, a frame size-by-frame size matrix. The first (frame size - 1)/2 rows are applied to the signal during the terminal transient. The last (frame size - 1)/2 rows are applied to the signal during the startup transient. The center row is applied to the steady state.

The differentiation coefficients, with size (polynomialOrder (parameter)+1)-by-frame size. The p-th row is for the p-th order derivative.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Dsp.Filters.WindowedFirBandpassFilter.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,NationalInstruments.Analysis.Dsp.Filters.FirWindowType)
member.summary: Creates a WindowedFirBandpassFilter using the specified filter parameters. Do not use this method with a Kaiser, Gaussian, or DolphChebyshev window.
member.param: The sampling frequency, in hertz.
The lower cutoff frequency, in hertz.
The upper cutoff frequency, in hertz.
The desired number of filter coefficients. The number of coefficients must be greater than zero.

The type of smoothing window specified using FirWindowType. Smoothing windows decrease ripple in the filter passband and improve the ability of the filter to attenuate frequency components in the filter stopband.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Dsp.NormalizationMethod
member.summary: Specifies the method used to compute the correlation of the input arrays.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Dsp.NormalizationMethod.None
member.summary: No normalization is used in the correlation computation of the input arrays.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Dsp.NormalizationMethod.Unbiased
member.summary: Uses the number of elements of the largest input array to normalize the correlation results.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Dsp.NormalizationMethod.Biased
member.summary: Uses the number of elements in both input arrays to normalize the correlation results.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Dsp.ScaledWindow.Apply(System.Double[],System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Applies a scaled window to the time-domain signal and outputs window constants for further analysis.
member.param: The input array.

Upon return, contains the equivalent noise bandwidth (ENBW) of the selected window. Use this value to divide a sum of individual power spectra of the power spectrum or to compute the power in a given frequency span.
Upon return, contains the inverse of the scaling factor applied to the window. Use this value to normalize peak signal gains to that of the rectangular window.

Upon return, contains the equivalent noise bandwidth (ENBW) of the selected window. Use this value to divide a sum of individual power spectra of the power spectrum or to compute the power in a given frequency span.
Upon return, contains the inverse of the scaling factor applied to the window. Use this value to normalize peak signal gains to that of the rectangular window.

member.param: The complex time-domain signal.

Specifies whether to shift the DC component to the center of the FFT. If shiftDC (parameter) is set to true, the FFT is DC-centered. The first element of the FFT is the -PI frequency element. The floor(number of elements in FFT / 2)^th element of FFT is the DC component.
member.returns: The FFT of the time-domain signal.
member.exception: inputData (parameter) is null.

member.summary: Computes the one-dimensional Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) of a complex time-domain signal, based on the size specified for the FFT.
member.param: The complex time-domain signal.

Specifies whether to shift the DC component to the center of the FFT. If shiftDC (parameter) is set to true, the FFT is DC-centered. The first element of the FFT is the -PI frequency element. The floor(number of elements in FFT / 2)^th element of FFT is the DC component.

The desired FFT size. If fftSize (parameter) is greater than the number of elements in inputData (parameter), this method pads inputData (parameter) with zeros to match fftSize (parameter). If fftSize (parameter) is smaller than the length of inputData (parameter), only the first fftSize (parameter) elements are used. If fftSize (parameter) is less than 1, this method sets the length of inputData (parameter) as fftSize (parameter).
member.returns: The FFT of the time-domain signal.

Specifies whether realData (parameter) is DC-centered. If shiftDC (parameter) is set to true, realData (parameter) is DC-centered. If set to false, realData (parameter) is not DC-centered. The first element of realData (parameter) is the DC component.

The desired FFT size. If fftSize (parameter) is greater than the number of elements in realData (parameter), this method pads realData (parameter) with trailing zeros to get a time-domain signal that has fftSize (parameter) elements. If fftSize (parameter) is smaller than the number of elements in realData (parameter), this method truncates realData (parameter). If fftSize (parameter) is less than 1, this method uses the number of elements in realData (parameter) for this parameter.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Dsp.Transforms.NetworkFunctions(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Calculates network transfer functions from stimulus and response data.
member.param: The network stimulus data. Each row represents one frame of the network stimulus and is associated with the corresponding row in response (parameter).

The network response data. Each row represents one frame of the network response and is associated with the corresponding row in stimulus (parameter). Specify this value in the same units as stimulus (parameter).

The sample period of the time-domain signal. The sample period is equivalent to 1/f, where f is the frequency of the stimulus (parameter) and response (parameter). You typically specify this value in units of seconds.

Upon return, contains the magnitude component of the averaged single-sided cross power spectrum between stimulus (parameter) and response (parameter). This value is in input units rms squared, where input units are the units of stimulus (parameter).
Upon return, contains the phase component of the the averaged single-sided cross power spectrum between stimulus (parameter) and response (parameter). This value is in units of radians.
Upon return, contains the magnitude component of the averaged single-sided transfer function between stimulus (parameter) and response (parameter).
Upon return, contains the phase component of the averaged single-sided transfer function between stimulus (parameter) and response (parameter).

Upon return, contains the single-sided coherence function spectrum. The coherence function shows the frequency content of response (parameter) due to stimulus (parameter) and measures the validity of the network frequency response measurement. This value is unitless and ranges from 0(no coherence) to 1(complete coherence).

Upon return, contains the impulse response of the network based on stimulus (parameter) and response (parameter). This value is in units of input units, where input units are the units of stimulus (parameter).
Upon return, contains the frequency interval. This value is in units of hertz if dt (parameter) is in units of seconds.
member.exception:
stimulus (parameter) is null.
-or- response (parameter) is null.

The number of samples in stimulus (parameter) is equal to zero.
-or-
The number of samples in response (parameter) is equal to zero.
-or- stimulus (parameter) and response (parameter) must have the same dimensions.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

A required operation in the analysis library cannot be found.

member.summary: Computes the two-dimensional Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) of a complex time-domain signal, based on the number of rows and columns specified for the FFT.
member.param: The complex time-domain signal.

Specifies whether to shift the DC component to the center of FFT. If shiftDC (parameter) is true, the resulting FFT is DC-centered. If shiftDC (parameter) is false, the first element of the resulting FFT is the DC component.

The number of rows on which to perform the FFT. If rowsForFft (parameter) is greater than the number of rows in inputData (parameter), this method pads inputData (parameter) with zeros to match rowsForFft (parameter). If rowsForFft (parameter) is less than the number of rows in inputData (parameter), this method uses only the leading rowsForFft (parameter) rows to perform the FFT. If rowsForFft (parameter) is less than one, this method sets the number of rows in inputData (parameter) as rowsForFft (parameter).

The number of columns on which to perform the FFT. If columnsForFft (parameter) is greater than the number of columns in inputData (parameter), this method pads inputData (parameter) with zeros to match columnsForFft (parameter). If columnsForFft (parameter) is less than the number of columns in inputData (parameter), this method uses only the leading columnsForFft (parameter) columns to perform the FFT. If columnsForFft (parameter) is less than one, this method sets the number of columns in inputData (parameter) as columnsForFft (parameter).
member.returns: The two-dimensional FFT of the complex time-domain signal.
member.exception: inputData (parameter) is null.
The analysis library cannot be found.

member.summary: Computes the one-dimensional Discrete Cosine Transform (DCT) of the input sequence with a specified DCT size.
member.param: The input sequence.

The length of the DCT to be performed. If dctSize (parameter) is greater than the number of elements in inputData (parameter), the method pads inputData (parameter) with zeros to make its number of elements equal to dctSize (parameter). If dctSize (parameter) is less than the number of elements in inputData (parameter), then inputData (parameter) is truncated. Only the leading dctSize (parameter) elements in inputData (parameter) are used to perform the DCT. If dctSize (parameter) is less than or equal to zero, the method uses the length of inputData (parameter) as dctSize (parameter).
member.returns: The one-dimensional DCT of inputData (parameter).

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.LogarithmType
member.summary: The base of the logarithm used by the LogarithmFit and LogarithmFitInPlace curve-fitting methods.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.LogarithmType.Natural
member.summary: The specified LogarithmFit and LogarithmFitInPlace curve-fitting method uses the natural logarithm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.LogarithmType.Base2
member.summary: The specified LogarithmFit and LogarithmFitInPlace curve-fitting method uses the base 2 logarithm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.LogarithmType.Base10
member.summary: The specified LogarithmFit and LogarithmFitInPlace curve-fitting method uses the base 10 logarithm.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.EigenVectorSide
member.summary: Specifies the type of generalized eigenvectors of the matrix pair (A,B).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.EigenVectorSide.Right
member.summary: The right generalized eigenvectors of matrix pair (A,B).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.EigenVectorSide.Left
member.summary: The left generalized eigenvectors of matrix pair (A,B).

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.PolynomialFitAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies the fit algorithm used by the specified PolynomialFit or PolynomialFitInPlace curve-fitting method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.PolynomialFitAlgorithm.Svd
member.summary: The specified PolynomialFit or PolynomialFitInPlace curve-fitting method uses the Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) algorithm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.PolynomialFitAlgorithm.QR
member.summary: The specified PolynomialFit or PolynomialFitInPlace curve-fitting method uses the QR algorithm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.PolynomialFitAlgorithm.LU
member.summary: The specified PolynomialFit or PolynomialFitInPlace curve-fitting method uses the LU algorithm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.PolynomialFitAlgorithm.Cholesky
member.summary: The specified PolynomialFit or PolynomialFitInPlace curve-fitting method uses the Cholesky algorithm.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.ReorderMechanism
member.summary: Specifies how to reorder the computed eigenvalues and corresponding Schur vectors.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.ReorderMechanism.None
member.summary: No reordering is done.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.ReorderMechanism.RealAscending
member.summary: The eigenvalues and corresponding Schur vectors are reordered in real ascending order.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.ReorderMechanism.RealDescending
member.summary: The eigenvalues and corresponding Schur vectors are reordered in real descending order.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.ReorderMechanism.MagnitudeAscending
member.summary: The eigenvalues and corresponding Schur vectors are reordered in magnitude ascending order.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.ReorderMechanism.MagnitudeDescending
member.summary: The eigenvalues and corresponding Schur vectors are reordered in magnitude descending order.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.SizeOption
member.summary: Specifies the size option for the SvdFactorization and QRFactorization methods.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.SizeOption.Full
member.summary: The full size option for the SvdFactorization and QRFactorization methods.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.SizeOption.Economy
member.summary: The economy size option for the SvdFactorization, and QRFactorization methods.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.RangeType
member.summary: Specifies the type of range used by the RemoveOutliersUsingRange method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.RangeType.YRange
member.summary: The range of Y is used by the RemoveOutliersUsingRange method. The first two elements in the range array are treated as the upper and lower bounds for the y-axis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.RangeType.XRange
member.summary: The range of X is used by the RemoveOutliersUsingRange method. The first two elements in the range array are treated as the upper and lower bounds for the x-axis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.RangeType.XAndYRange
member.summary: The range of X and the range of Y are both used by the RemoveOutliersUsingRange method. The first and second element in the range array are the upper and lower bounds for the x-axis, and the third and fourth element in the range array are the upper and lower bounds for the y-axis.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.CurveFit.GeneralLeastSquaresFit(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double[],NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.BestFitAlgorithm,System.Double[]@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Calculates the k-dimension linear curve values and the set of k-dimension linear fit coefficients, which describe the k-dimension linear curve that best represents the input data set using the least-squares solution. Use this method if the standard deviation is unknown or if all the standard deviations are equal, and if the matrix of covariances is not required.
member.param: The input matrix that represents the formula used to fit the data set {X,Y}. The number of rows in hMatrix (parameter) must be greater than or equal to the number of columns.
The array whose elements contain the y coordinates of the (x,y) data sets to be fitted. The number of elements in this array must be equal to the number of rows in hMatrix (parameter).
The algorithm to use in solving the multiple linear regression model. This parameter is specified using BestFitAlgorithm.
Upon return, contains the set of linear coefficients that best fit the multiple linear regression model in a least-squares sense.
Upon return, contains the mean squared error generated by the difference between the fitted curve and the raw data.
member.returns: The best fitted curve.
member.exception: hMatrix (parameter) is singular.

hMatrix (parameter) is null.
-or- inputYData (parameter) is null.

The number of rows in hMatrix (parameter) is not the same size as inputYData (parameter).
-or-

-or-
Order is less than or equal to zero.
-or-
Order is greater than 90.
-or-

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.LinearAlgebra.LUFactorization(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Int32[]@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Performs LU ComplexDouble matrix decomposition.
member.param: On input, contains the square matrix to be LU factorization decomposed. Upon return, contains the LU factorization decomposed matrix.
Upon return, contains the permutation information obtained from the LU factorization decomposition. This vector is needed if you plan to call ForwardSubstitution.

Upon return, contains the number of row exchanges that occurred during the LU factorization decomposition. This output is 0 if there was an even number of row exchanges, or no exchanges. This output is 1 if there was an odd number of row exchanges during the LU factorization decomposition.
member.returns: The LU factorization decomposed matrix.
member.exception: matrix (parameter) is singular.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.LinearAlgebra.MatrixBalance(System.Double[0:,0:],NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.BalanceMethod,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Balances, in place, a real, general matrix so that its eigenvectors can be computed more accurately.
member.param: On input, the matrix to be balanced. On output, the balanced matrix.

An enumeration specifying how to balance the matrix. This is a value from the BalanceMethod enumeration. If balanceMethod (parameter) is NeitherPermutedNorScaled, indexLow (parameter) = 0, indexHigh (parameter) = matrix size - 1, scale[i] = 1, where i = 0 to matrix size - 1.

Upon return, contains the low index that records the permutation information. The indexLow (parameter) and indexHigh (parameter) values are such that on output, balanced matrix[i,j] is 0, if i j and (i j < indexLow (parameter) or indexHigh (parameter) < i matrix size - 1).

Upon return, contains the high index that records the permutation information. The indexLow (parameter) and indexHigh (parameter) values are such that on output, balanced matrix[i,j] is 0, if i j and (i j < indexLow (parameter) or indexHigh (parameter) < i matrix size - 1).
member.returns: The scale information.
member.exception: inputSquareMatrix (parameter) is null.
inputSquareMatrix (parameter) is not a square matrix.
Specified balanceMethod (parameter) is invalid.
The analysis library cannot be found.
A required operation in the analysis library cannot be found.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.LinearAlgebra.MatrixBalance(System.Double[0:,0:],NationalInstruments.Analysis.Math.BalanceMethod,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Double[0:,0:]@)
member.summary: Balances a real, general matrix so that its eigenvectors can be computed more accurately.
member.param: The matrix to be balanced.

An enumeration specifying how to balance the matrix. This is a value from the BalanceMethod enumeration. If balanceMethod (parameter) is NeitherPermutedNorScaled, indexLow (parameter) = 0, indexHigh (parameter) = matrix size - 1, scale[i] = 1, where i = 0 to matrix size - 1.

Upon return, contains the low index that records the permutation information. The indexLow (parameter) and indexHigh (parameter) values are such that on output, balancedMatrix (parameter)[i,j] is 0, if i j and (i j < indexLow (parameter) or indexHigh (parameter) < i matrix size - 1).

Upon return, contains the high index that records the permutation information. The indexLow (parameter) and indexHigh (parameter) values are such that on output, balancedMatrix (parameter)[i,j] is 0, if i j and (i j < indexLow (parameter) or indexHigh (parameter) < i matrix size - 1).
The balanced matrix.
member.returns: The scale information.
member.exception: inputSquareMatrix (parameter) is null.
inputSquareMatrix (parameter) is not a square matrix.
Specified balanceMethod (parameter) is invalid.
The analysis library cannot be found.
A required operation in the analysis library cannot be found.

member.summary: Finds the first level-crossing location in a signal.

Threshold value the signal must cross before a trigger is detected.

member.summary: Finds the first level-crossing location in multiple channels.

Array of threshold values for each channel which the input signal must cross before a trigger is detected.

Specifies whether to initialize the trigger detection.

member.returns: An array indicating whether a valid trigger is detected for each channel.

member.param: The data to be processed.

The Boolean the specifies whether the input array being processed is the last block of data. Set this input to true if the current input array is the last data block being processed. Otherwise, set this input equal to false. To process only one block of data, set this input to true.
The array that contains the amplitudes of the peaks/valleys found in the current block of data.

The array which contains the locations of the peaks/valleys found in the current block of data. Locations are reported in indices from the beginning of processing (the most recent call to Detect since the last Reset).
The array which contains the second derivatives of the peaks/valleys found in the current block of data.

The level that all valid peaks must equal or exceed for the duration of width (parameter) samples.

This value determines the minimum width, in number of samples, that inputData (parameter) must remain at or above the threshold (parameter) value for the candidate peak to be considered valid. width (parameter) must be greater than zero. If width (parameter) is less than or equal to zero, the method throws an exception.
member.returns: The beginning index of all valid peaks in inputData (parameter). If no peaks are found then an empty array is returned.

The center frequency in Hertz, of the resulting Gaussian modulated sinusoidal pattern. This parameter must be positive.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Analysis.SpectralMeasurements.MultipleToneInformation
member.summary: Finds the frequency, amplitdue, and phase for each real signal tone whose amplitude exceeds a specified threshold. This class also provides methods to get additional signal and magnitude spectrum information.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Analysis.SpectralMeasurements.MultipleToneInformation.#ctor(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,NationalInstruments.Analysis.SpectralMeasurements.ToneSortingOrder)
member.summary: Constructs a new MultipleToneInformation object and computes the frequency, amplitude, and phases of each signal tone present in the provided signal, which is above the specified threshold, and sorts them based on the specified value set by ToneSortingOrder.
member.param: A time-domain signal to measure.
The rate, in hertz, at which the points in the input signal are acquired or generated.
The minimum amplitude, in Vp, which each tone must exceed. Signal tones present in the signal (parameter), which are below the threshold, will not be found.

Specifies the maximum number of tones to find in the signal (parameter). This value must be greater than 0. To find out exactly how many signal tones were found, you can use the DetectedToneCount property.
Specifies the sorting order of the detected tones based on the specified value set by ToneSortingOrder.
member.exception: signal (parameter) is null.
The input signal frequency is very close to the Nyquist frequency.

The number of samples in signal (parameter) is less than six.

-or- maximumToneCount (parameter) is less than or equal to zero.

member.summary: Specifies the method used to determine the high and low state levels of the signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.SpectralMeasurements.MeasurementMethod.Histogram
member.summary: Returns the levels of the histogram bins with the maximum number of hits in the upper and lower regions of the waveform. The upper and lower regions of the waveform include the upper and lower 40%, respectively, of the peak-to-peak range of the waveform.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.SpectralMeasurements.MeasurementMethod.Peak
member.summary: Searches the entire waveform for maximum and minimum levels of the waveform.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Analysis.SpectralMeasurements.MeasurementMethod.AutoSelect
member.summary: Determines whether the histogram bins that correspond to the high and low state levels each have over 5% of the total hits. Otherwise, the Peak MeasurementMethod is used. This ensures a reasonable answer for either a square wave, ignoring the overshoot and preshoot, or a triangle wave, where a histogram fails.

The number of samples in the time-domain signal array before it was passed to the AutoPowerSpectrum. This is typically the number of samples in one block of data from a data acquisition operation. If set to zero, the frame size used is set to twice the size of the autoPowerSpectrum (parameter) array.
The number of harmonic components to approximate and use in the THD measurement.
The window selection used for the ScaledWindow.
The input sampling rate, in hertz.

An estimate of the fundamental frequency to use in the harmonic search and in the THD computation. If set to zero, the frequency of the largest non-DC component found in autoPowerSpectrum (parameter) is used as the fundamental frequency.

The array of amplitudes of the fundamental component and its harmonics. These values are always positive and are in units of volts rms if the input auto power spectrum values are given in volts rms squared.
The array of frequencies of the fundamental component and its harmonics. These values are in units of hertz if the input sampling rate is given in hertz.
Upon return, contains the percent total harmonic distortion plus noise present in autoPowerSpectrum (parameter).

member.summary: Computes the period, pulse duration, and duty cycle of a selected pulse and period using the specified MeasurementMethod.
member.param: The waveform to measure. Each waveform is required to contain at least pulseNumber (parameter) complete cycles, where a cycle is defined as the interval between two consecutive midReferenceLevel (parameter) crossings in the same direction.

Specifies the high reference level of the waveform in ReferenceLevelUnit. After the signal crosses the midReferenceLevel (parameter) in the rising direction, it must cross the highReferenceLevel (parameter) before the next falling midReferenceLevel (parameter) crossing can be counted.

Specifies the middle reference level of the waveform in ReferenceLevelUnit. The interval between consecutive rising midReferenceLevel (parameter) crossings defines one cycle, or period, of the waveform. At least one high or low reference level crossing must separate each midReferenceLevel (parameter) crossing.

Specifies the low reference level of the waveform in ReferenceLevelUnit. After the signal crosses the midReferenceLevel (parameter) in the falling direction, it must cross the lowReferenceLevel (parameter) before the next rising midReferenceLevel (parameter) crossing can be counted.
Specifies whether the reference level inputs are interpreted as a percentage of the full range of the waveform or as absolute levels.
Specifies which pulse of MeasurementPolarity, high or low, to measure.
Specifies the pulse to measure. A pulseNumber (parameter) of n with high MeasurementPolarity selected indicates that the method measures the nth rising pulse it detects in the input waveform.
Upon return, contains the time between adjacent midReferenceLevel (parameter) crossings in the same direction, in seconds.
Upon return, contains the time difference, in seconds, between the first two midReferenceLevel (parameter) crossings of the pulseNumber (parameter) you specify.

Upon return, contains a fraction of a period (parameter). dutyCycle (parameter) is also known as duty factor. dutyCycle (parameter) is calculated by the following equation: dutyCycle (parameter) = 100*(pulseDuration (parameter)/period (parameter)).

Upon return, contains the highReferenceLevel (parameter) of the signal (parameter) in Absolute ReferenceLevelUnit.
Upon return, contains the midReferenceLevel (parameter) of the signal (parameter) in Absolute ReferenceLevelUnit.
Upon return, contains the lowReferenceLevel (parameter) of the signal (parameter) in Absolute ReferenceLevelUnit.

member.summary: Computes the slope, transition duration, undershoot, and overshoot of a selected pre-transition and post-transition region in each waveform using the peak MeasurementMethod and the default histogram size of 256.
member.param: The waveform to measure. Each waveform is required to contain at least edgeNumber (parameter) transitions in the direction of the MeasurementPolarity. A rising transition is the interval between adjacent rising lowReferenceLevel (parameter) and highReferenceLevel (parameter) crossings. A falling transition is the interval between adjacent falling highReferenceLevel (parameter) and lowReferenceLevel (parameter) crossings.

Specifies the high reference level of the waveform in ReferenceLevelUnit. After the signal crosses the midReferenceLevel (parameter) in the rising direction, it must cross the highReferenceLevel (parameter) before the next falling midReferenceLevel (parameter) crossing can be counted.

Specifies the middle reference level of the waveform in ReferenceLevelUnit. The interval between consecutive rising midReferenceLevel (parameter) crossings defines one cycle, or period, of the waveform. At least one high or low reference level crossing must separate each midReferenceLevel (parameter) crossing.

Specifies the low reference level of the waveform in ReferenceLevelUnit. After the signal crosses the midReferenceLevel (parameter) in the falling direction, it must cross the lowReferenceLevel (parameter) before the next rising midReferenceLevel (parameter) crossing can be counted.
Specifies whether the reference level inputs are interpreted as a percentage of the full range of the waveform or as absolute levels.
Specifies which pulse of MeasurementPolarity, high or low, to measure.

Specifies the transition to measure. An edgeNumber (parameter) of n with high MeasurementPolarity selected indicates that the method measures the nth rising transition it detects in the input waveform.
Upon return, contains a measure of the rate of change of the signal in a transition region between highReferenceLevel (parameter) and lowReferenceLevel (parameter).

Upon return, contains the time span, in seconds, from when the waveform crosses the lowReferenceLevel (parameter) until it crosses the highReferenceLevel (parameter) for a high MeasurementPolarity, or from when the waveform crosses the highReferenceLevel until it crosses the lowReferenceLevel for a low MeasurementPolarity.
Upon return, contains the time of the rising midReferenceLevel (parameter) crossing that defines the start of the measurement interval.
Upon return, contains the time of the rising midReferenceLevel (parameter) crossing that defines the end of the measurement interval.
Upon return, contains the highReferenceLevel (parameter) of the signal (parameter) in Absolute ReferenceLevelUnit.
Upon return, contains the midReferenceLevel (parameter) of the signal (parameter) in Absolute ReferenceLevelUnit.
Upon return, contains the lowReferenceLevel (parameter) of the signal (parameter) in Absolute ReferenceLevelUnit.
Upon return, contains the undershoot in the pre-transition aberration region of the waveform in signal (parameter).
Upon return, contains the overshoot in the pre-transition aberration region of the waveform in signal (parameter).
Upon return, contains the undershoot in the post-transition aberration region of the waveform in signal (parameter).
Upon return, contains the overshoot in the post-transition aberration region of the waveform in signal (parameter).

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Analysis.SpectralMeasurements.MultipleToneInformationComplex
member.summary: Finds the frequency, amplitdue, and phase for each complex signal tone whose amplitude exceeds a specified threshold. This class also provides methods to get additional signal and magnitude spectrum information.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Analysis.SpectralMeasurements.MultipleToneInformationComplex.#ctor(NationalInstruments.ComplexDouble[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,NationalInstruments.Analysis.SpectralMeasurements.ToneSortingOrder)
member.summary: Constructs a new MultipleToneInformationComplex object and computes the frequency, amplitude, and phases of each signal tone present in the provided signal, which is above the specified threshold.
member.param: A time-domain signal to measure.
The rate, in hertz, at which the points in the input signal are acquired or generated.
The minimum amplitude, in Vp, which each tone must exceed. Signal tones present in the signal (parameter), which are below the threshold, will not be found.

Specifies the maximum number of tones to find in the signal (parameter). This value must be greater than 0. To find out exactly how many signal tones were found, you can use the DetectedToneCount property.
Specifies the sorting order of the detected tones based on the specified value set by ToneSortingOrder.
member.exception: signal (parameter) is null.
The input signal frequency is very close to the Nyquist frequency.

The number of samples in signal (parameter) is less than six.
